channel.title: Protocol Labs R&D
channel.description: Driving Breakthroughs in Computing to Push Humanity Forward.

item.title: F3 and GossipBFT: Fast finality on longest-chain protocols
item.description: We present F3, a finality component designed to bring fast finality to Filecoin. F3 leverages a novel consensus protocol, GossiPBFT, that runs on the side and finalizes tipsets in tens of seconds instead of hours, while laying the basis for verifiable cross-chain bridging.

item.title: A finality calculator for Filecoin’s Expected Consensus
Filecoin Proof of Useful Space
Security analysis of Filecoin's Expected Consensus in the Byzantine vs honest model
Janus and Granite
item.description: Henrique presents Janus and Granite, a consensus framework and algorithm to bring fast finality to the Filecoin network.

item.title: Base fee manipulation in Ethereum's EIP-1559 transaction fee mechanism
Scalable asynchronous randomized byzantine agreement
item.description: Most algorithms solving Byzantine agreement that are implemented and used in practice today rely on some form of synchrony assumptions. Especially when used in blockchain systems, where scalability is of great importance, purely asynchronous solutions suffer from high message complexity or strong as

item.title: tlock: Practical timelock encryption based on threshold BLS
item.description: We present a practical construction and implementation of timelock encryption, in which a ciphertext is guaranteed to be decryptable only after some specified time has passed. We employ an existing threshold network, the League of Entropy, implementing threshold BLS in the context of Boneh and Frank

item.title: A metaverse of walled gardens?
item.description: The way in which the development and commercialisation of the metaverse unfold may result in an open architecture for collaborative innovation and participation, or in a series of silos tightly controlled by a small number of commercial entities. But does the outcome even matter? And, if so, how can

item.title: SpaceVDF: Verifiable delay functions using cryptographic satellites
LURK: Lambda, the ultimate recursive knowledge
tlock: Practical timelock encryption from threshold BLS
Generalized Impact Evaluators
Pikachu: Securing PoS blockchains from long-range attacks by checkpointing into Bitcoin PoW using Taproot
Enriching Kademlia by partitioning
Interplanetary Consensus: Now playing in Eudico near you
item.description: Alfonso de la Rocha, Research Engineer at ConsensusLab, describes the technical details of interplanetary consensus.

item.title: Interplanetary Consensus: Scaling blockchains with subnets in an easy-to-trust model
item.description: Guy Goren, Research Scientist at ConsensusLab, presents a simplified subnet model for blockchain scaling.

item.title: Applications of Interplanetary Consensus
item.description: Juan Benet, CEO of Protocol Labs, outlines the scaling requirements of web3 and the many applications of IPC.

item.title: Realising web3: 15 months of ConsensusLab
item.description: Marko Vukolic, ConsensusLab lead at Protocol Labs, reviews the work done by ConsensusLab since its creation and its future directions.

item.title: Building modular and scalable BFT consensus using the Mir framework
item.description: Matej Pavlovic, Research Scientist at ConsensusLab, introduces the Mir framework and the work being done at ConsensusLab implementing performant BFT consensus.
